intro: Tagetes zypaquirensis, commonly known as the Zypariensis marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are composed of ray florets and tubular disk florets, typical of the daisy family. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes and has some traditional medicinal uses.
